data.text: Front Rack for a Mountain Bicycle
Recommendations for a front rack that will fit on a mountain bike ?
Old Man Mountain. Not cheap but solid well made and weight is directly onto the thru axles
data.author: Ian Hinchliffe

data.text: Excessive weight on front axle = interference with steering !!

data.author: Charlie Brown

data.text: No, not on a suspension fork .. there are rigid forks made to swap in place & not drop the head tube changing the steering feel...
data.author: Robert Clark
Tony Campbell

data.text: Thule makes one that clamps onto that kind of fork. I have two more recommendations, also. Get a slick tire designed specifically for turbo trainers, a "trainer tire". Get rid of your current rear rack and get one that uses your frame's existing rack mounting points as it will be lower, better balanced, more stable and lighter weight.
data.author: Nathan Turnage

data.text: thanks I was thinking of replacing the tires for road tires I don't want to wear this one out on the trainer as far as the rack I bought what I could afford I am disabled so it will most likely not get loaded with a big load as I will not be going on long adventures maybe some over night trips . It's going to be rigged out just in case God allows me the ability to take my dream trip to Italy

data.text: If I need more than rears alone, i use a one wheel trailer. Offroading with weight on the front has never worked for me.

Check out also what bike packers use. In essence you can strap things to your handle bar bag. The budget option is to bungee on a dry bag or buy something like this https://www.ortlieb.com/uk_en/handlebar-pack

data.text: Iâ€™ve an e-bike with Rockhopper forks (no lugs). My solution was to use rubber-lined P-clips for the low-rider rack. Very solid.

data.text: Personally.. that single peace of equipment is a very, very default peace of gear. I liked alot of the fully ridged ones.. liked meaning tolerable... but never had one that don't end up sagging over time. Messing with the tention of your cables. An I've had 3. Or four. Do alot of bikepacking. I really think a look at a mini front rack is the way to go. You can get alot on one.. and..... its ridged.. an that's the key for me.
data.author: Buck Murphy

data.text: The specialized cradle I think it's called was best... but slipped a little. An the hole mounting, an amountng was a pain in the ass.
